item.title: 中国建筑设备销售量激增，预示经济复苏
item.description: 上半年，中国主要建筑机械销量大幅增长，表明这一经济关键领域的需求有所改善。【原文：China’s key construction machinery sales jumped in the first half, indicating improving demand across the economically crucial sector.】

item.title: 50%的关税是惩罚，而非贸易
item.description:
如果说咖啡的价格还不够高，那么挤压巴西市场则意味着美国人将支付更高的价格。【原文：

As if coffee didn’t already cost enough, squeezing Brazil means Americans will pay even more.

】

item.title: 中国多晶硅价格因希望抑制竞争而飙升
item.description: 在中国最高领导层广泛承诺抑制企业间竞争后，中国的多晶硅价格出现了近两年来的最大涨幅，从而提振了对该行业前景的乐观情绪。【原文：Polysilicon prices in China jumped the most in almost two years after a broad pledge by the country’s top leadership to curb competition among businesses boosted optimism in the outlook for the industry.】

item.title: 美国因担心寄生蝇而暂停重启墨西哥牛贸易
item.description: 由于担心一种寄生蝇的传播，美国停止了从墨西哥进口牲畜，而就在几天前，墨西哥刚刚恢复了牲畜贸易。【原文：The US has halted livestock imports from Mexico on concerns over the spread of a parasitic fly, just days after the trade resumed.】

item.title: 曼哈顿房租再创新高，未来涨幅还会更大
item.description: 在过去五个月中，曼哈顿的租金第四次创下历史新高，而在市场最繁忙的季节，公寓买家的心情却丝毫没有放松的迹象。【原文：Manhattan rents hit a record high for the fourth time in the past five months — and there’s no relief in sight for apartment hunters in the market’s busiest season.】

item.title: 顶级首席执行官希望加拿大建立国防战略矿产储备
item.description: 据一个有影响力的商业团体称，加拿大应成为生产和加工军事装备和国防系统原材料的世界领导者。【原文：Canada should become a world leader in producing and processing raw materials for military equipment and defense systems, according to an influential business group.】

item.title: 非洲各国央行权衡特朗普关税下的政策选择
item.description: 非洲主要经济体将在未来几周内确定不同的利率政策，因为它们要衡量美国总统唐纳德-特朗普新关税提案的影响及其对本国经济和通胀的影响。【原文：Key African economies are set to stake out different approaches to interest rates in the coming weeks as they gauge the impact of US President Donald Trump’s new tariff proposals and their domestic influences on their economies and inflation.】

item.title: NTT 出售 177 亿美元外国债券，创亚洲交易纪录
item.description: 日本电信巨头 NTT 公司周三出售了 177 亿美元的美元和欧元债券，创下了亚洲企业在全球债务市场发行债券的最大纪录。【原文：Japanese telecom giant NTT Inc. sold $17.7 billion of dollar and euro bonds on Wednesday, marking the biggest-ever offering by an Asian corporate in the global debt market.】

item.title: 降息后马来西亚债券外流可能昙花一现
item.description: 马来西亚本周降息，可能会助长对进一步宽松政策的押注，马来西亚主权债券市场看来有望从近期的抛售压力中反弹。【原文：Malaysia’s sovereign bond market looks poised to bounce back from recent selling pressure, after a rate cut this week that may fuel bets on further easing.】

item.title: 日本 20 年期债券销售需求低于 12 个月平均水平
item.description: 日本 20 年期国债拍卖的需求低于过去 12 个月的平均水平，因为即将举行的大选凸显了日本主权债务继续上升的可能性。【原文：Demand at Japan’s 20-year government bond auction was lower than the average over the past 12 months, as an upcoming election highlights the likelihood that the nation’s sovereign debt will keep rising.】

item.title: 美国征税在即，中国呼吁东南亚支持开放
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）威胁对东南亚各国征收全面关税之际，中国外交部长王毅周四呼吁东南亚各国坚持开放与合作，传递出包容性的信息。【原文：Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi called on Southeast Asian nations to uphold openness and cooperation Thursday, delivering a message of inclusivity as President Donald Trump threatens sweeping tariffs on nations across the region.】

item.title: 富士媒体提出毒丸辩护后股价下跌
item.description: 富士媒体控股公司（Fuji Media Holdings Inc.【原文：Fuji Media Holdings Inc. shares fell 4.2% after the broadcaster said it’s considering measures to stop one of Japan’s most prominent activist investors from gaining control of the firm.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行董事会成员将根据与财务主管达成的协议发表演讲
item.description: 澳大利亚财政部长吉姆-查默斯（Jim Chalmers）和储备银行利率制定委员会已同意，委员会成员每年至少发表一次演讲或参与公共活动，并公布未署名的投票结果。【原文：Australian Treasurer Jim Chalmers and the Reserve Bank’s interest-rate setting board have agreed that members will conduct at least one speech or public engagement a year, as well as publishing unattributed votes.】

item.title: 印度盈利季来临，塔塔咨询服务公司备受瞩目
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 印度首次公开募股将在下半年激增中筹集高达 180 亿美元的资金
item.description: 据杰富瑞金融集团（Jefferies Financial Group）称，印度的一级市场在经历了年初的低迷后将迎来强劲反弹，预计 2025 年下半年通过首次公开募股将筹集到高达 180 亿美元的资金。【原文：India’s primary market is set for a strong rebound after a slow start to the year, with up to $18 billion expected to be raised through initial public offerings in the second half of 2025, according to Jefferies Financial Group.】

item.title: 日产将在 40 亿美元债券销售中提供创纪录的高额票息
item.description: 日产汽车公司预计将以创纪录的高票面利率出售其即将发行的 40 亿美元外币债券中的一部分，这将给这家陷入困境的日本汽车制造商带来更大的压力，因为它正努力扭转其业务。【原文：Nissan Motor Co. is expected to sell some of its upcoming $4 billion foreign-currency bonds at a record-high coupon, piling more pressure on the struggling Japanese automaker as it seeks to turn around its business.】

item.title: JM 预计印度 IPO 十年内将增加 3 万亿美元市值
item.description: JM Financial Ltd.副董事长兼总经理维沙尔-坎帕尼（Vishal Kampani）认为，印度首次公开发行股票的热潮可能会在未来十年内增加 2 万亿至 3 万亿美元的市场价值。【原文：The boom in initial public offerings in India could add $2 trillion to $3 trillion in market value over the next decade, according to Vishal Kampani, vice chairman and managing director of JM Financial Ltd.】

item.title: 贷款增长乏力拖累印度银行债券销售创 11 年新低
item.description: 印度银行的卢比债券销售额降至 11 年来最低，与蓬勃发展的企业债务市场大相径庭。【原文：Indian banks’ rupee-bond sales have dropped to the lowest in 11 years, diverging sharply from a booming corporate debt market.】

item.title: 比亚迪和其他电动汽车电池制造商面临更大的减排压力
item.description: 环保组织绿色和平（Greenpeace）表示，包括比亚迪股份有限公司（BYD Co.【原文：Electric vehicle battery suppliers, including BYD Co. and EVE Energy Co., need to step up efforts to switch to clean power at manufacturing sites and curb emissions in supply chains, according to environmental group Greenpeace.】

item.title: 高盛斥资 1.9 亿美元收购首尔酒店和零售资产
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. has acquired the four-star Mercure Ambassador hotel in Seoul, as the US bank seeks to bolster its real estate alternatives business in South Korea.】

item.title: 泰国超长期债券因关税和政治危机而上涨
item.description: 泰国的较长期限债券正在成为投资者寻求避开美国提高关税和国内政治动荡对经济影响的首选。【原文：Thailand’s longer-maturity bonds are emerging as the top pick for investors seeking shelter from the economic impact of higher US tariffs and domestic political turmoil.】

item.title: 日本汽车制造商降低对美出口价格以抵消关税打击
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）对汽车征收关税之际，日本汽车制造商以创纪录的速度削减了出口到美国的产品价格，这表明企业正在牺牲利润以保持竞争力。【原文：Japan’s automakers slashed the price of products exported to the US at a record pace, in a sign that companies are sacrificing profits to remain competitive as President Donald Trump’s tariffs hit cars.】

item.title: CATL 在香港的股价上涨 46%，使其在中国的溢价率创下新高
item.description: 当代安培瑞斯科技股份有限公司（Amperex Technology Co.安培雷斯科技有限公司在香港的交易价格较其在中国大陆上市的股票溢价创下新高，这很可能表明全球投资者对这家电池巨头的浓厚兴趣。【原文：Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. is trading at a record premium in Hong Kong over its mainland China-listed stock, likely an indication of global investors’ strong interest in the battery giant.】

item.title: 尽管特朗普加征关税，澳大利亚对美牛肉出口仍大幅增长
item.description: 面对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的新关税制度，澳大利亚6月份对美国的牛肉出口总量大幅增长，美国领导人特别指出堪培拉拒绝接受足够的红肉进口。【原文：Australia’s total beef exports to the US rose significantly in June in the face of President Donald Trump’s new tariff regime, which saw the American leader specifically single out Canberra for refusing to accept adequate red meat imports.】

item.title: 特朗普称对铜进口征收 50%关税将于 8 月 1 日生效
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）表示，美国将从 8 月 1 日起对进口铜征收 50%的关税，此举将对依赖工业金属的汽车、住宅和电器等产品的生产商造成打击。【原文：President Donald Trump said the US would begin levying a 50% tariff on copper imports from Aug. 1, confirming a move that will batter producers of everything from automobiles to homes and appliances who rely on the industrial metal.】

item.title: 房市反弹、关税成为焦点，日本银行维持利率不变
item.description: 韩国央行周四维持政策利率不变，因为它正在监测早些时候的宽松举措对飙升的房价和受到美国提高关税威胁的经济的影响。【原文：The Bank of Korea left its policy rate unchanged Thursday as it monitors the impact of its earlier easing moves on soaring home prices and an economy threatened by higher US tariffs.】

item.title: 香港捍卫货币带的努力才刚刚开始
item.description: 香港的货币防卫已成为威胁其新生经济复苏的平衡之举。【原文：Hong Kong’s currency defense has become a balancing act that threatens its nascent economic recovery.】

item.title: Baillie Gifford 称中国科技企业的关键在于消费者而非关税
item.description: Baillie Gifford & Co.称，中国科技巨头将摆脱美国提高关税的影响，因为它们的前景现在更依赖于当地消费者的情绪。【原文：China’s technology giants are set to shrug off the impact of higher US tariffs as their outlook is now far more dependent on local consumer sentiment, according to Baillie Gifford & Co.】

item.title: 韩国前总统尹炳世因戒严调查被捕
item.description: 韩国法院签发了对前总统尹锡烈的逮捕令，在他因试图对韩国实施戒严令而失败获释四个月后再次将其拘留。【原文：A South Korean court issued a warrant to arrest former President Yoon Suk Yeol, putting him back in detention four months after he was released over his botched attempt to put the country under martial law.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行为代币化结算研究项目选择公司
item.description: 澳大利亚中央银行已指定将参与代币化资产结算研究项目的行业参与者。【原文：Australia’s central bank has named the industry participants that will participate in a tokenized asset settlement research project.】
